message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.DB, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the extraction and representation of medical knowledge from electronic medical records (EMRs) for clinical decision support (CDS) tasks. This involves the use of Markov random fields (MRF) and distributed representation learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.AI, which deals with artificial intelligence and machine learning. The use of distributed representation learning also suggests the possibility of the paper belonging to cs.LG, which deals with machine learning and optimization. The paper also involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques for extracting medical entities from EMRs, which suggests the possibility of it belonging to cs.CL, which deals with computational linguistics. The use of EMRs also suggests the possibility of the paper belonging to cs.DB, which deals with databases and information retrieval. Finally, the paper involves the use of MRF for inference, which suggests the possibility of it belonging to cs.IR, which deals with information retrieval and web search.
